item.title: The Analogue 3D will be available again next week, but with a $20 price bump
item.content:encoded:
Andrew Liszewski

is a senior reporter who’s been covering and reviewing the latest gadgets and tech since 2006, but has loved all things electronic since he was a kid.

Analogue has announced its reimagined and upgraded 4K version of the Nintendo 64, the Analogue 3D, is being restocked and will be available again for preorder starting at 8 AM PT/11 AM ET on Monday, November 24th.

That’s good news for those of us who missed out on the initial preorders that quickly sold out, but unfortunately, the restocked Analogue 3D is getting a price bump from $249.99 to $269.99 “due to tariffs,” the company announced on X.

The restocked consoles will start shipping on December 2nd, 2025. Analogue says the first preorders are its top priority and that “all open orders will ship before restock orders ship.” That means new orders could be delayed if something throws a wrench into Analogue getting the first ones out the door.

The Analogue 3D, announced in October 2023, hit repeated delays before finally shipping on November 18th. Like the company’s previous consoles, including the Game Boy-inspired Analogue Pocket and the Super Nt that recreated the Super Nintendo, the Analogue plays original N64 cartridges from every region, including both PAL and NTSC carts, using an FPGA that perfectly recreates the Nintendo 64’s functionality rather than emulating it.

The Analogue 3D works with original N64 controllers. It’s also compatible with a wireless controller from 8BitDo explicitly designed for the console.
